references.paper_title: Masked autoencoders are scalable vision learners
references.reason: This paper introduces Masked Autoencoders (MAE), a self-supervised learning approach that significantly influenced the design of the two-stage masked token prediction framework in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Bridging the domain gap: Self-supervised 3D scene understanding with foundation models
references.reason: This is the authors' own previous work that directly inspired the current research, especially in using foundation models for 3D scene understanding.
The Segment Anything Model (SAM) is a key component of the proposed SAM-guided tokenization method, which improves the alignment between 2D and 3D representations.
The AdamW optimizer, introduced in this paper, is used for training, demonstrating its importance in optimizing the model's performance.

references.paper_title: Deep Hough voting for 3D object detection in point clouds
references.reason: VoteNet, a foundational 3D object detection model, is used as a baseline for comparison in the experimental section, highlighting its relevance to the field.
